alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued February 13 at 8:58AM PST until February 15 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TUESDAY TO 10 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 4 to 7 feet with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Highest surf on west-facing beaches of Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast and Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast. * WHEN...From 4 AM Tuesday to 10 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast
